required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Evaluation of the Team Birth Project
clinical_study.official_title: A Program Evaluation to Measure the Feasibility of the Team Birth Project

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the feasibility of a pilot project to improve communication and teamwork and to increase vaginal delivery rates at hospital in the United States

primary_outcome.time_frame: The six-week window centered on 180 days from the start date at each site (166 days to 194 days) If clinicians complete more than one survey in the window, we will use the first one
primary_outcome.description: After six months of use, percent of clinicians (physicians, midwives, and nurses) who would definitely or probably recommend the Team Birth project tools for use in other labor and delivery units.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The six-week window centered on 180 days from the start date at each site (166 days to 194 days)
primary_outcome.description: After six months of use, percent of patients who definitely or somewhat had the role they wanted in making decisions about their labor, among patients who wanted to make collaborative decisions with clinicians.

arm_group.description: Health facility that has piloted the "Team Birth Project"

intervention.description: The study sites will pilot the Team Birth Project designed to improve team communication (between providers, as well as providers and patients). The project includes three key implementation steps that involve: preparing local sites for the implementation of the project; training and coaching on the use of the tools; and sustainment through peer coaching and data feedback. A mixed methods approach will be used to assess acceptability and feasibility, including: (1) clinician surveys and interviews, (2) implementation team focus groups, and (3) patient surveys.

criteria.textblock:
Clinician Participant Inclusion Criteria:
- All clinicians who have practice privileges at a study site
Clinician Participant Exclusion Criteria:
Implementation Team Participant Inclusion Criteria:
- Champions, super-users and others who have been involved in the implementation of "Team Birth Project" at a study site
Implementation Team Participant Exclusion Criteria:
Patient Participant Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years or older
- Live birth. Includes: spontaneous or induction of labor; Vaginally, with an instruments (forceps / vacuum), or unscheduled cesarean delivery
- Patient at a study site piloting "Team Birth Project"
Patient Participant Exclusion Criteria:
- Under 18 years old
- Scheduled cesarean delivery
- Experienced intrapartum, stillbirth, or neonatal death
